public static <T> Stream<T> of(@Nonnull T... values)

      • empty

        Type Parameters:

        Returns:
        the new stream.

      • ofNullable

        public static <T> Stream<T> ofNullable(@Nullable T value)
        Creates a stream that emits the value parameter as an item if the value is not null.
        Type Parameters:
        T - the type of items contained in the stream.
        Parameters:
        value - the value to emit if non null.
        Returns:
        the new stream.

      • fail

        public static <T> Stream<T> fail(@Nonnull Throwable error)
        Creates a stream that emits no items and immediately emits an error signal. This is an alias for error(Throwable).
        Type Parameters:
        T - the type of items that the stream declared as containing (despite never containing any items).
        Parameters:
        error - the error to emit.
        Returns:
        the new stream.
        See Also:
        error(Throwable)

      • fromStream

      • fromCallable

        public static <T> Stream<T> fromCallable(@Nonnull Callable<T> callable)
        Creates an infinite stream that emits items from the Callable parameter. The user must be very careful to add a subsequent stream stage that cancels the stream otherwise this source will result in an infinite loop.
        Type Parameters:
        T - the type of items contained in the stream.
        Parameters:
        callable - the function that generates values to emit.
        Returns:
        the new stream.

      • fromSupplier

        public static <T> Stream<T> fromSupplier(@Nonnull Supplier<T> supplier)
        Creates an infinite stream that emits items from the Supplier parameter. The user must be very careful to add a subsequent stream stage that cancels the stream otherwise this source will result in an infinite loop.
        Type Parameters:
        T - the type of items contained in the stream.
        Parameters:
        supplier - the function that generates values to emit.
        Returns:
        the new stream.

      • fromRunnable

        public static <T> Stream<T> fromRunnable(@Nonnull Runnable runnable)
        Creates a stream that completes when the Runnable parameter completes running. The stream will signal an error if the runnable generates an error while running.
        Type Parameters:
        T - the type of items that the stream declared as containing (despite never containing any items).
        Parameters:
        runnable - the runnable to execute.
        Returns:
        the new stream.

      • generate

        public static <T> Stream<T> generate(@Nonnull Supplier<T> supplier,
                                     int period)
        Creates an infinite stream that emits items from the Supplier parameter at specified period. The user must be very careful to add a subsequent stream stage that cancels the stream otherwise this source will result in an infinite loop.
        Type Parameters:
        T - the type of items contained in the stream.
        Parameters:
        supplier - the function that generates values to emit.
        period - the period with which items are emitted.
        Returns:
        the new stream.

      • never

        public static <T> Stream<T> never()
        Creates a stream that emits no items, never completes and never fails.
        Type Parameters:
        T - the type of items that the stream declared as containing (despite never containing any items).
        Returns:
        the new stream.

      • range

        public static Stream<Integer> range(int start,
                                    int count)
        Create a stream that emits a sequence of numbers within a specified range. The stream create a sequence of [start, start + count).
        Parameters:
        start - the starting value of the range
        count - the number of items to emit
        Returns:
        the new stream.

      • periodic

        public static Stream<Integer> periodic(int period)
        Create a stream that emits sequential numbers every specified interval of time. The stream create a sequence of [start, start + count).
        Parameters:
        period - the period with which items are emitted.
        Returns:
        the new stream.
